ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la gÿo sẅíŋtè tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g fó tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́ʼ, ńtuɔ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, mbɔɔ shúm pwɔʼ se mbʉ́lè. Legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńké ḿbú ńjÿó ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: When Solomon finished praying,   fire descended from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices,  # 7:1 Gn 15:7–17; Lv 9:24; Jdg 6:21–24; 1Kg 18:24,38 and the glory of the Lord filled the temple.

ngiemboon: Panuŋepwɔʼ la te kuʼu le kúu ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́, mélàʼmie legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la pú ńjÿó ndá ntsèm.
en: The priests were not able to enter the Lord’s temple because the glory of the Lord filled the temple of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ metsèm pie é laa jʉʼó, é la gyá páʼ mmɔ̌g pɔ́ legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fǒ tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́ʼ ńjÿó ndá Ssé, ńdeen ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yɔ́b kíbe ssé, ńzɔb, ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Oon áa mbòŋ, nkwòŋe ye, ée ye temì.»
en: All the Israelites were watching when the fire descended and the glory of the Lord came on the temple. They bowed down on the pavement with their faces to the ground. They worshiped and praised the Lord:

ngiemboon: Afùɔ pâ láʼ la pú ńnuŋe pwɔʼ, ńdɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: The king and all the people were offering sacrifices in the Lord’s presence.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la lɔg mefòŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né móm mbʉ́a nzèm ntsáʼ pʉ́a (2 022), ńgÿo mejʉ̀njÿò pâ mvfó móm mbʉ́a nzèm nkÿo, ńtóo lénuŋe pwɔʼ we mbʉ́lè: Ńnuŋe púʼu legwɔ́ gie pâ pʉ̀a láʼa Ésàlayɛ ge lɔg ńcʉ́me ndá mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand cattle and one hundred twenty thousand sheep and goats. In this manner the king and all the people dedicated God’s temple.

ngiemboon: Panuŋepwɔʼ la tyé ncwò fàʼ pɔ́b. Epʉ̀a Lěvî ne ḿbúʼu shúm leluŋó se ndʉalʉ̌a sie fùɔ Ndavîd la gÿo mé nyɛte; pɔ́ la ne ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńtí nkwòŋe ye gie ée těen ḿmaga wɔ́, éfó na zɔbɔ ntse gie fùɔ Ndavîd la náa mbwó pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: «Oon, nkwòŋe ye, ée ye temì.» Panuŋepwɔʼ la tyé mvfò pɔ́b ńne ńtóŋo ntaŋ. Aláʼa ntsèm pú ńtyé tyé.
en: The priests and the Levites were standing at their stations. The Levites had the musical instruments of the Lord, which King David had made to give thanks to the Lord  #— #“for his faithful love endures forever” #— #when he offered praise with them.   Across from the Levites, the priests were blowing trumpets, and all the people were standing.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ lyɛʼó, afùɔ Salémo lɔgɔ tetʉ́a ntsèm gie áa ncwò ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgÿo ye Ssé, ńtí páʼ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte, á la kɔ́g lélɔg ńtuɔ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, mbɔɔ létuɔ mejʉʼ mbab mbòŋo mie é gẅiin mefóon. Afùɔ Salémo laa púʼu ńgee ńtuɔ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm mbɔɔ lélɔg mejʉʼ mbab mbòŋo mie é gẅiin mefóon ńnuŋe pwɔʼ, é gíŋe ná pwɔʼ shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, é lɔgɔ púʼu ńgwɔ́ pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè.
en: Since the bronze altar that Solomon had made   could not accommodate the burnt offering, the grain offering, and the fat of the fellowship offerings, Solomon first consecrated the middle of the courtyard  # 7:7–10 1Kg 8:64–66 that was in front of the Lord’s temple and then offered the burnt offerings and the fat of the fellowship offerings there.  # 7:7 Lv 7:30–31

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo pâ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm la jÿó línɔ̀ɔn mentàb fʉʼó na lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a. Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la fó meshÿó meshÿó, ńtó, léfó Lembo-Amad á shÿó kwóŋ, ńgʉa gʉa ńkúu fúʼu ssé Egíbtò, á shÿó ntsíŋ.
en: So Solomon and all Israel with him #— #a very great assembly, from the entrance to Hamath   to the Brook of Egypt #— #observed the festival at that time for seven days.

ngiemboon: Alyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn yelÿò, á laa na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè lefɔ̌ɔn. Mélàʼmie pɔ́ la cÿɔʼɔ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ cÿɔʼ ńcʉ́me mbwó Ssé melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn jÿǒ melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: On the eighth day   they held a solemn assembly,  # 7:9 Lv 23:36 for the dedication of the altar lasted seven days and the festival seven days.

ngiemboon: Á la táa ńgwɔ́ na lyɛ̌ʼ ntsɔ̀b tá né móm mbʉ́a, á na saŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, afùɔ tsẅi pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ piŋ né membʉ̀a mɔ́b. Pɔ́ la gwaa piŋ, lekág gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pɔ́b tà ńdúe. Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńkága mélàʼmie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gẅiin pòŋontʉ́m nzèm fùɔ Ndavîd, mbɔɔ nzèm fùɔ Salémo, mbɔɔ na pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ pie ée pʉ̀a pé.
en: On the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people home,   rejoicing and with happy hearts for the goodness the Lord had done for David, for Solomon, and for his people Israel.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie fùɔ Salémo la maga lékwɛ́ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ ye, mbɔɔ shúm ntsèm sie à la kwaŋa légÿo na mɛ̌ mendá mémbʉ́a,
en: So Solomon finished the Lord’s temple and the royal palace. Everything that had entered Solomon’s heart to do for the Lord’s temple and for his own palace succeeded.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tóo mvfò yé letsẅɛ́ʼ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «N juʼú sẅíŋtè jú, n kaŋá yɔɔn jʉʼ páʼ mé ge láʼa tóo wó, é nuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò mèŋ.
en: Then the Lord appeared to Solomon at night and said to him:

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńgwɔ́ péʼe ńjÿɔ́ʼ lefaŋ tà mbʉ̀ŋ te gíŋe ńdú wɔ́, kà ńtúm pɔ́ ngǐm ngie e tó ḿbyág shúm tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ wɔ́ɔ, kà ńtúm pɔ́ gwáʼa na láʼ yɔ́ɔn mɔ́ɔ,
en: If I shut the sky so there is no rain, or if I command the grasshopper to consume the land, or if I send pestilence on my people,

ngiemboon: epʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn pie n da gÿo pɔ́ zsé lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, é sẅíʼi mbùm yɔ́b, ńgÿo sẅíŋtè ḿbiŋ faʼa wɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ lɔɔn fó na memánzsè tepòŋ mɔ́b ḿbiŋ, mbà mèŋ n ge fó tÿǒ lepwó, é júʼ ngyè yɔb, é lege mefʉa mɔ́b, e néŋe sẅétè tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ wɔ́b.
en: and my people, who bear my name, humble themselves, pray and seek my face, and turn from their evil ways, then I will hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and heal their land.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge nyɛ́ʼ menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, é téŋe tuŋó yɔ́ɔn, é zẅíʼte sẅíŋtè ntsèm gie mé ge gÿo mbwó mèŋ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ndá Ssé.
en: My eyes will now be open and my ears attentive to prayer from this place.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n dɔ̌g lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńcÿɔʼ yɔɔn ndá gie ɔ̀ ka kwɛ́ páʼ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ge ne gwɔ́ tsoló fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńdɔg ńgÿo yɔ̀ɔn; menÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn ge ne gwɔ́ wó fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: And I have now chosen and consecrated this temple so that my name may be there forever; my eyes and my heart will be there at all times.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgiŋe mvfò mèŋ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ tá gú fùɔ Ndavîd, né letʉ́m ndʉalʉ̌a mbɔɔ légÿo kwàʼ mmó gie n da cʉ́me mbwó gù, ḿbiŋ ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mentÿɔgɔ́, mbɔɔ membʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn,
en: As for you, if you walk before me as your father David walked, doing everything I have commanded you, and if you keep my statutes and ordinances,

ngiemboon: mbà n ge gÿo lefùɔ shú tʉte fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm. Páʼ n da kaʼa mbwó tá gù fùɔ Ndavîd. N da kaʼa mbwó yé ngie à těen ńdáʼa ńzága míŋ we gẅie à ge jÿó ndá ye, é néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé, á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm, á fʉ̀ʼ gie à te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: I will establish your royal throne, as I promised your father David: You will never fail to have a man ruling in Israel.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi lâ penkʉ́ pí lɔɔn ńdʉʼʉ le cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, ḿbiŋ ńdʉʼʉ le tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na membʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ mentÿɔgɔ́ mɔ́ɔn mie n da náa mbwó pi, ńgʉa faʼa mbwó tsɔ́ messé, ńkẅíʼte mvfò pɔ́b ńguʼte wɔ́b,
en: However, if you turn away and abandon my statutes and my commands that I have set before you and if you go and serve other gods and bow in worship to them,

ngiemboon: mbà mèŋ n ge jwoŋo gẅí, pi pʉ̀a láʼa Ésàlayɛ, á na tsetsáʼ gie n da náa mbwó pi, é tsɔ́ʼ lejÿɔ́g sɔ́ɔn na ndá gie n da cyɔʼ lélɔg ńgéʼe lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, à cʉa púʼu, mé gÿo ńne ńzoonte pʉ̀a láʼa Ésàlayɛ, ḿbiŋ ńne ńgẅe wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ meláʼ ntsèm.
en: then I will uproot Israel from the soil that I gave them, and this temple that I have sanctified for my name I will banish from my presence;   I will make it an object of scorn and ridicule among all the peoples.  # 7:20 Dt 28:37

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ púʼu, epʉ̀a gÿo ne ńcʉa ngʉ̀ŋe yɔɔn ndá gie e laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, ńgúʼ tɛʼ, à kʉʼʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ mɔɔn, ńcÿo ngwòŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie: “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gǎa ńgÿo páʼɔɔn na yɔɔn láʼ, mbɔɔ na yɔɔn ndá?”
en: As for this temple, which was exalted, everyone who passes by will be appalled and will say,   “Why did the Lord do this to this land and this temple?”

ngiemboon: Mé tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: “Ée mélàʼmie epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ka gwáʼa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔb gẅie à la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńkẅile metá pɔ́b, ńgʉa ńcʉ́me nzèm tsɔ́ messé, ńkẅíʼte mvfò pɔ́b, ńguʼte wɔ́b. Áa yɛ̌ tá, eyɔɔn ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ kúu wɔ́b.”»
en: Then they will say, “Because they abandoned the Lord God of their ancestors who brought them out of the land of Egypt. They clung to other gods and bowed in worship to them and served them. Because of this, he brought all this ruin on them.”
